team-build-data.rage_build: Stack Rage on the midliner and backliner as quickly as possible, enter Fury Mode and annihilate the opponent with crits.
team-build-data.rationale_part_1: Damage dealers have as many rage-stacking abilities as possible, along with high damage attacks and attacks which synergise well with Fury mode such as Ronin and Post-Fight.0
team-build-data.rationale_part_2: Tank has 3 summon abilities which boost Rage output of Little Branch.
team-build-data.rationale_part_3: Summons and heals add some sustain and protect the damage dealers.
team-build-data.strong_against_part_1: Sustain teams - Fury mode can burst through with single-turn kills, preventing a sustain team from healing back up.
team-build-data.strong_against_part_2: Poison/Bleed teams - Burst damage and aggression will usually take the upper hand before Poison/Bleed can tick down the opponent's health quickly enough.
team-build-data.weak_against_part_1: Backdoor teams - Opponents can often use targetting abilities to kill our damage dealer before we can stack enough Rage to hit Fury mode.
team-build-data.weak_against_part_2: Curses teams - Getting the most out of Fury mode is highly dependent on getting a good card draw. Disrupting our deck with curse cards lowers our chances as the battle goes on, and can make it very difficult to capitalise on Fury Mode rounds.
